Extra Techs from non-rare CD's?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Shrine Topics: CDs & Slating: Extra Techs from non-rare CD's?
By B Campbell on Monday, February 18, 2002 - 09:43 am:

I'm cataloging more CD's, since there are literally thousnads of them in the house I'm living in. I want to add as much info as I can, so I added a column in my Excel worksheet for extra techs. I know most rare monsters start with three techs, and I've had monsters in MR1 off of normal CD's with three techs. Has anyone seen a monster with more than two techs, that's not rare, in MR2 off a CD? It would save me alot of time schlepping to and from the market if I could get a definite NO.

By Omni Strunks on Monday, February 18, 2002 - 10:35 am:

Uh, I've seen three.

Tiger with Roar added tech from Rolling Stones: Bridges to Babylon, Loveseeker that starts with UFO Attack in the Lab subcodes, and that Worm that starts with some tech..forgot what it was.

By John Hawley on Monday, February 18, 2002 - 10:36 am:

We have the code for a Worm (Worm/Worm) in the Lab that has a third tech and twenty extra weeks of life. We think the programmers did it deliberately though, just like the Monol that has 25 in all stats. In other words, a hard-coded Rare without the Rare designation. So the answer is Yes. Good Luck with your cataloging.

By B Campbell on Monday, February 18, 2002 - 11:23 am:

Okay, so monsters with more than two techs from a CD are 'rare', in the sense that it's a deliberate, pre-programmed monster. I seem to remember that Rolling Stones album giving a rare tiger in MR1 or somesuch. I guess this just means it will take more time... Thanks guys

By nathaniel zdanowicz on Monday, March 18, 2002 - 03:49 pm:

my offspiring Americana Cd makes a plane worm that starts off with roll assault!

By Battle Fencer on Tuesday, June 25, 2002 - 05:29 pm:

The Bust-A-Move 4 for Playstation has a Cinder Bird (Pheonix/???) that has fire stream.
